p: Regarding the fatty acid composition of sunflower oil, high-oleic hybrids showed on average 90.4% and 2.9% of oleic and linoleic acids respectively, whereas linoleic hybrids displayed a 35.6% of oleic acid and a 55.1% of linoleic. The amount of both fatty acids was only dependent on the hybrid type (oleic model: χ 2 = 134.73, df = 1, p < 0.001; linoleic model: χ 2 = 107.22, df = 1, p < 0.001), and oil composition was not affected by cross-pollination through insect visits (oleic model: χ 2 = 0.86, df = 2, p = 0.65; linoleic model: χ 2 = 1.96, df = 2, p = 0.38) or the interaction pollination treatment-hybrid type (oleic model: χ 2 = 3.12, df = 2, p = 0.21; linoleic model: χ 2 = 0.32, df = 2, p = 0.85).
